text: Dr Mackie Ratwatte was a Sri Lankan physician. He was a former Private Secretary to the Prime Minister of Sri Lanka and Director General and Secretary of the Fifty Summit Conference of Non-Aligned Countries.When AG and judge differSeevali passes away after decades of silent service Ratwatte was born to a prominent Radala family, who were descended from Ratwatte Dissawa, Dissawa of Matale, a signatory on behalf of the Sinhalese to the Kandyan Convention of 1815. Born to Barnes Ratwatte Dissawa and Rosalind Mahawelatenne Kumarihamy of Mahawelatenne Walauwa, Balangoda, his eldest sister was Sirimavo Bandaranaike the first female prime minister in the world. He was educated at Trinity College, Kandy and the Colombo Medical College. ==See also== *List of political families in Sri Lanka ==References== ==External links== * The Ratwatte Ancestry * Travelling in a Capitalist Vehicle Through Socialist Crowds in an Earlier Era Category:1910s births Category:2004 deaths Category:Sinhalese physicians Category:Sri Lankan Buddhists Category:Alumni of Trinity College, Kandy Mackie
